annonstext:
Who are we?
Volvo Cars is a company on a mission; to bring traditional car manufacturing into a connected, sustainable and smart future.
Since 1927, we have been a brand known for our commitment to safety, creating innovative cars that make life less complicated for our consumers. In 2010, we decided to transform our business, resulting in a totally new generation of cars and technologies, as well as steady growth and record sales. Today, we’re expanding our global footprint in Europe, China and the US, and we’re on the lookout for new talent. 
We are constantly pushing our own skills and abilities to drive change in the automobile industry like never before. We are looking for innovative, committed people to join us in this endeavour and create safe, sustainable and connected cars. We believe in the power of people and will challenge and support you to reach your full potential. Join us and be part of Volvo Cars’ journey into the future.

Drive the driver experience
We make innovative human-centric car technology available that makes life less complicated and more enjoyable. If you are interested in design, connected car technology and share our passion for people, the environment and have an urge to create outstanding driving experience, please read on.
We at Driver Information have the purpose to “drive the driver experience”. We are in one of the fastest growing areas within automotive today. Competition is not only limited to traditional automotive competitors. Innovative and fast-moving companies like Google and Apple are influencing competition heavily. Volvo Cars has successfully launched a cutting-edge driver interaction and infotainment solution and is committed to continuous success.
What you will do
As an experienced Software Developer at Driver Information, you will become a member of a tight agile development team, which is responsible for the delivery of the whole software package for the driver centric displays in the car. Together with other specialists within user experience and system development, you will be working on the software development for the instrument cluster and head up displays at Volvo Cars.
Who you are
To thrive in this role, we believe you feel comfortable in a leading position, have strong communication and analytical skills. You are person with a proactive approach, a problem solver and a flexible team player. We are looking for a structured, enthusiastic, self-driven and results oriented person, who has a high ability to work in teams, but also independently. You are genuinely driven by motivating others and autonomy in your work. You embrace development on a technical as well as on personal level.
For this role, it is important that you have strong skills in C++ programming, preferably in C++11/C++14. We also expect a solid background in Python programming.
Since we are a global company, fluency in English (written and spoken) is a must.
It is meritorious if you bring the following with you:
  *  Knowledge of HMI systems and Unreal engine
  *  Experience in working with ASIL B compliant SW development
  *  Knowledge of SOMEIP/CAN/LIN protocols
  *  Experience in developing for QNX/posix platforms
  *  Experience in CI work with Git/FIRSTNAME/LASTNAME/Artifactory
